page.title: 06FARMING - LIVESTOCK
page.content: Park Farm rears bull beef. We saw them in the very large cattle shed. They were black and white and looked very well although one was in a pen on its own with stiff shoulders - it was hoped that it would recover. There are about 150 on the farm at any one time between 10 weeks and one year old. They are bought in from the West Country - a grass growing area unlike Norfolk, reared at Long Sratton and come to Park Farm at 10 weeks. The bull calves are fed chopped maize, beef nuts and minerals. An experimental group are fed on beef nuts only - they are growing faster. The shed used to be full of cows, the milking parlour is still there but Mr Alston went out of milk three years ago.
